Hi,You may need to consult a Physician and through blood tests, diagnose the cause for your symptoms.It could related to diabetes,thyroid issues, circulatory problem, high cholesterol levels etc. If all are Ok, you may need to consult a neurologist for further assessment.Solace

question: Hello, for the past say 2 years my concentration levels have been dropping, also i'm finding it hard to remember words & understand words,fairly complicated ones also how to spell as well plus that i used to be able to just think of naturally but i now i find myself stopping mid sentence regularly as i can't think of the words to say. I'm tired nearly all day even after a good sleep. I find that i can't concentrate on anything either, which may be due to my lack of motivation, i am 41 and i'm currently doing driving lessons, so i have theory test coming up  ill sit down, get everything in order but then i won't be able to concentrate on it at all, i'll go off task or just stare at my book. Then i'll get really sad and annoyed that i haven't done anything and i'll try and try to work but nothing comes of it. I've also gained weight recently and i'm starting to feel down in the evenings. Any help or suggestions of whats wrong would be greatly appreciated, thank you.
title: can't concentrate on anything
